definition-item.definition-title: CABLES; CONDUCTORS; INSULATORS; SELECTION OF MATERIALS FOR THEIR CONDUCTIVE, INSULATING OR DIELECTRIC PROPERTIES (selection for magnetic properties H01F1/00; waveguides H01P {; printed circuits H05K})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Electrical conductors or cables characterised by their conductive material or form including power cables, communication cables or conductors, and superconductors or hyperconductive conductors, cables or transmission lines.
Electrical insulators or insulating bodies characterised by their insulating or dielectric material or form, including capacitor-type insulators.
Apparatus or processes specially adapted for manufacturing conductors or cables.
Apparatus or process specially adapted for manufacturing insulators or insulating bodies.
Apparatus or process for salvaging material from cables.

section-body.paragraph-text: Electrical conductors or cables characterised by their conductive material or form including power cables, communication cables or conductors, and superconductors or hyper-conductive conductors, cables or transmission lines are classified in H01B1/00 - H01B1/24

Insulators based on inorganic materials are classified in H01B3/02 - H01B3/16; Insulators based on fibrous materials (e.g. fabric, paper) are classified in H01B3/48 - H01B3/545; Insulators based on gases are classified in H01B3/56
Non-insulated conductors or conductive bodies characterized by their form can be found in H01B5/00 - H01B5/16
Insulated conductors or cables characterized by their form are classified in H01B7/00 - H01B7/428
Power Cables are classified in H01B9/00 - H01B9/0694
Communication Cables are classified in H01B11/00 - H01B11/22
Superconductive or hyper-conductive conductors, cables or transmission lines are classified in H01B12/00 - H01B12/16
Apparatus or processes specially adapted for manufacturing conductors or cables are classified in H01B13/00 - H01B13/348
Apparatus or process for salvaging material from cables are classified in H01B15/00 - H01B15/008
Insulators or insulating bodies characterised by their form are classified in H01B17/00 - H01B17/66
Apparatus or processes specially adapted for manufacturing insulators or insulating bodies are classified in H01B19/00 - H01B19/04

table-column.paragraph-text: Electrical cables or conductors of the waveguide type
Electrically-conductive connections; Structural associations of a plurality of mutually-insulated electrical connecting elements; Coupling devices

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:
Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Cables or wires comprising electrodes, or feed-throughs for implantation or insertion into the body
Storing or paying-out lengths of conductors or cables
Passages or insulators for monitoring in nuclear reactors
Insulating of windings for manufacturing coils
Coaxial lines for handling frequencies considerably beyond the audio range
Coaxial cables functioning as an antenna
Installations of electric cables or lines, or of combined optical and electric cables or lines
Cables with separate protective tubings or conduits
Details of windings of dynamo-electric machines characterized by the conductor or insulating material

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Processes for applying liquids or other fluent materials to surfaces to obtain a coating with specific electrical properties
Superconductors characterized by a ceramic forming technique or ceramic composition
Light guides; Structural details of arrangements comprising light guides and other optical elements, e.g. coupling
Passages or insulators for nuclear reactors, e.g. for electric cables
Transmission lines of the waveguide type, disclosing typical HF-features, e.g. propagation of non-TEM modes, multimodes or particular dimension adapted for HF-propagation
Wire processing before connecting to contact members
Cable insulation removal methods and apparatus
Arrangements leading cables or lines through walls
Circuit arrangements or systems for supplying of distributing electric power
Wire processing for making windings for dynamo-electric machines
Screening of apparatus or components against electric or magnetic fields

section-body.paragraph-text: Group H01B12/00 takes precedence over groups H01B5/00, H01B7/00, H01B9/00, and H01B11/00.
Cables including at least one electrical conductor together with optical fibers are classified in group H01B11/22.

Device aspects of an invention are to be classified in H01B5/00, H01B7/00, H01B9/00, H01B11/00, H01B12/00 and H01B17/00, method aspects of an invention are to be classified in H01B13/00. Therefore, there are corresponding subgroups, see table below:

table-column.paragraph-text: Protection against moisture, chemical attack or weather
Indices being imposed on the insulation
Mark being a tape, thread or wire
Mark being a sleeve, tag or clip
Cables with twisted pairs or quads
Pairs or quads mutually positioned to reduce crosstalk
Coaxial cables, construction of conductors, e.g. inner and outer conductor
Coaxial cables, construction of the insulation between conductors
Coaxial cables, insulators of cellular structure

section-body.paragraph-text: Within each main group of this subclass, in the absence of an indication to the contrary, classification is made in the last appropriate place.

definition-item.definition-title: Conductors or conductive bodies characterised by the conductive materials; Selection of materials as conductors

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Conductors or conductive bodies characterised by the conductive materials; Selection of materials as conductors

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Groups H01B1/14 - H01B1/24 take precedence over groups H01B1/02 - H01B1/12

definition-item.definition-title: organic substances {(organic macromolecular compounds or compositions C08)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Conductive material dispersed in non-conductive organic material {(organic macromolecular compounds or compositions C08)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Insulators or insulating bodies characterised by the insulating materials; Selection of materials for their insulating or dielectric properties

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Insulators or insulating bodies characterised by the insulating materials
Selection of materials for their insulating or dielectric properties

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Superconductors characterized by a ceramic forming technique or ceramic composition
Selection of piezoelectric or electrostrictive materials

definition-item.definition-title: metallic oxides (ceramics H01B3/12)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: mainly consisting of organic substances {(organic macromolecular compounds or compositions C08)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Electrical insulators or insulating bodies characterised by their insulating or dielectric material or form, including capacitor-type insulators.

Insulating materials based on organic substances including cellulose and derivatives, organic liquids, asphalt- and bitumen-based materials, natural and synthetic rubber, polymeric materials including resins and waxes.

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Macromolecular compounds obtained only by reactions involving unsaturated carbon-to-carbon bonds
Macromolecular compounds obtained otherwise than by reactions only involving unsaturated carbon-to-carbon bonds
Additives for polymer compositions in general
Passages or insulators for nuclear reactors, e.g. for electric cables

section-body.paragraph-text: For applications which deal with polymer compositions comprising inorganic additives, where it is not apparent, whether the invention resides in the polymeric or the inorganic component, the application should be classified in the relevant subgroups of both the inorganic additive and the polymeric component.

Insulating materials comprising compositions of different organic insulating materials are classified in each relevant subgroup (e.g. an insulating layer comprising a polyethylene and a polystyrene is classified in both H01B3/441 and H01B3/442).
Groups H01B3/18, H01B3/30, H01B3/42, H01B3/44 are only used when no relevant subgroup is available
The group H01B3/30 is used for insulating materials characterized by predominantly by physical properties
No new documents are classified in H01B3/308.
In H01B3/47 the plastic is also classified in the relevant groups above

definition-item.definition-title: liquids, e.g. oils (silicone oils H01B3/46)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: plastics; resins; waxes

section-body.paragraph-text: Group H01B3/47 takes precedence over groups H01B3/32 - H01B3/46.

definition-item.definition-title: Waxes (silicone waxes H01B3/46)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: vinyl resins; acrylic resins (silicones H01B3/46)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: fibrous materials (fibre-reinforced plastics H01B3/47)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Insulators or insulating bodies characterised by the insulating materials comprising fibrous materials like fabric, wood, paper, press board
This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: Non-insulated conductors or conductive bodies characterised by their form

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Non-insulated electrical conductors or cables by their type; constructional details of non-insulated electrical conductors or cables.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Conductors or conductive bodies characterised by the conductive material

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Features peculiar to electrified wire fencing
Metal cables or ropes not for conducting electricity

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

definition-item.definition-title: {Fence-wire not otherwise provided for (wire fencing E04H17/02)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

definition-item.definition-title: Several wires or the like stranded in the form of a rope

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Overhead lines for high voltage power distribution, including overhead lines comprising thin protective layers, e.g. against corrosion or weather attack. Such thin protective layers are not considered as conductor insulation.

definition-item.definition-title: comprising conductive layers or films on insulating-supports

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Insulating-layers or insulating-films on metal bodies

definition-item.definition-title: comprising conductive material in insulating or poorly conductive material, e.g. conductive rubber (H01B1/14, H01B1/20 take precedence; insulating bodies with conductive admixtures H01B17/64; conductive paints C09D5/24)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Conductive material dispersed in non-conductive inorganic material
Conductive material dispersed in non-conductive organic material

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Insulated conductors or cables characterised by their form

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Insulated electrical conductors or cables by their type; constructional details of insulated electrical conductors or cables.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Insulation characterised by the insulating materials
Power cables with voltage ratings above about 1 KV, also welding cables, e.g. with current ratings above about 50 A

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Cables or wires comprising electrodes for implantation into the human body, e.g. heart electrode
Non-integral, removable labels for electric cables

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Arrangements for storing and repeatedly paying-out and re-storing lengths of conductors or cables
Code or colour marking of optical cables

section-body.paragraph-text: This group is subdivided either into insulated conductors or cables by their type, e.g.:
H01B7/0045 (cable harnesses)
H01B7/0054 (cables with incorporated electric resistances)
H01B7/0063 (ignition cables)
H01B7/0072 (electrical cables comprising fluid supply conductors)
H01B7/0081 (cables of rigid construction)
H01B7/009 (cables with build-in connection points or with predetermined areas for making deviations)
H01B7/04 (flexible insulated cables, conductors or cords)
H01B7/06 (extensible conductors or cables)
H01B7/08 (flat or ribbon cables)
H01B7/10 (contact cables)
H01B7/12 (floating cables)
H01B7/14 (submarine cables)
H01B7/16 (rigid-tube cables)
or by general constructional details of insulated conductors or cables, e.g.:
H01B7/0009 (details relating to the conductive cores)
H01B7/02 (disposition of insulation)
H01B7/17 (protection against damage caused by external factors)
H01B7/30 (with arrangements for reducing conductor losses when carrying AC)
H01B7/32 (with arrangements for indicating defects)
H01B7/36 (with distinguishing or length marks)
H01B7/38 (with arrangements for facilitating removal of insulation)
H01B7/40 (with arrangements for facilitating mounting and securing)
H01B7/42 (with arrangements for heat dissipation or conduction)

definition-item.definition-title: {Strip or foil conductors (H01B7/08 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: {Cables of rigid construction (rigid-tube cables H01B7/16)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: Disposition of insulation

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Extensible conductors or cables, e.g. self-coiling cords

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Arrangements for storing and repeatedly paying-out and re-storing lengths of conductors or cables

definition-item.definition-title: Floating cables

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Installations of cables supported on or from floats

definition-item.definition-title: Rigid-tube cables

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Protection against damage caused by external factors, e.g. sheaths or armouring

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Protections not provided for in groups H01B7/182 - H01B7/26}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: {Radial force absorbing layers providing a cushioning effect (H01B7/185 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Sheaths comprising internal cavities or channels

definition-item.definition-title: {Protection against damage caused} by moisture, corrosion, chemical attack or weather

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Insulated conductors or cables characterised by their form: Protection against damage caused by moisture, corrosion, chemical attack or weather
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Preventing penetration of fluid {, e.g. water or humidity,} into conductor or cable

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Insulators or insulating bodies with surfaces specially treated for preserving insulating properties, e.g. for protection against moisture, dirt

definition-item.definition-title: Protection against damage caused by extremes of temperature or by flame {(heat dissipation or conduction H01B7/42)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Protection of cables against damage caused by extremes of temperature or by flame
This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: with arrangements for indicating defects, e.g. breaks or leaks

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: with arrangements for heat dissipation or conduction

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Insulators or insulating bodies characterised by their form having heating or cooling devices

definition-item.definition-title: Power cables

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Electrical power cables by their type, wherein voltage ratings are typical above about 1 KV and/or current ratings are typical above about 50 A; constructional details of power cables.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Flexible power cables for e.g. portable tools, mobile objects and machinery

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Cables comprising optical elements and electrical power conductors, where the optical aspect is of interest

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
This group is subdivided either into power cables by their type, e.g.:
H01B9/001 (welding cables)
H01B9/008 (for overhead application)
H01B9/04 (concentric cables)
H01B9/06 (gas-pressure, oil-pressure cables or cables for use in conduits under pressure)
or by general constructional details of power cables, e.g.:
H01B9/006 (constructional features relating to the conductors)
H01B9/003 (including electrical control or communication wires)
H01B9/005 (including optical transmission elements)
H01B9/02 (with screens or conductive layers)

definition-item.definition-title: Communication cables or conductors

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Electrical communication cables carrying telecommunication or data signals in a frequency range less than the microwave range (less than several hundred MHz).
Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Coaxial cables being a waveguide handling frequencies in the several hundred MHz range (e.g. microwaves)
Coaxial cables functioning as an antenna

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Internal space filling-up means, e.g. splines

section-body.paragraph-text: This group is subdivided either into communication cables by their type, e.g.:
H01B11/02 (communication cables with twisted pairs or quads)
H01B11/18 (coaxial cables)
H01B11/22 (communication cables including at least one electrical conductor together with optical fibres)
or by general constructional details of communication cables, e.g.:
H01B11/002 (pair constructions)
H01B11/005 (quad constructions)
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

definition-item.definition-title: Cables with twisted pairs or quads

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Transposing, crossing or twisting at joints

definition-item.definition-title: with pairs or quads mutually positioned to reduce cross-talk

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Balancing by making use of additional capacitors or coils

definition-item.definition-title: with means for reducing effects of electromagnetic or electrostatic disturbances, e.g. screens

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Arrangements for exhibiting specific transmission characteristics

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Cables, e.g. submarine cables, with coils or other devices incorporated during cable manufacture

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Coaxial cables; Analogous cables having more than one inner conductor within a common outer conductor

section-body.paragraph-text: If suitable for handling frequencies considerably beyond the audio range and if typical HF-features of coaxial cables are disclosed, e.g. propagation of non-TEM modes, multimoding, oversized coaxial cables, particular cross-section adapted for HF-propagation, classification is made in H01P3/06.

definition-item.definition-title: Superconductive or hyperconductive conductors, cables, or transmission lines

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Superconductive conductors, cables or transmission lines characterised by their form;
Processes specially adapted for manufacturing superconductive conductors, cables or transmission lines.

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Processes peculiar to the manufacture or treatment of filaments of superconductive composite wires
Details or devices using superconductivity or hyperconductivity characterised by the material

definition-item.definition-title: characterised by their form

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:
The groups H01B12/04 - H01B12/10 do not cover:
Group H01B12/12 takes precedence over groups H01B12/04 - H01B12/10

definition-item.definition-title: Apparatus or processes specially adapted for manufacturing conductors or cables

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Apparatus or processes specially adapted for manufacturing non-insulated or insulated electrical conductors, wires or cables.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus or processes specially adapted for manufacturing superconductive cables

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Stranding metal cables or ropes not for conducting electricity
Wire processing before connecting to contact members

section-body.paragraph-text: Subgroups comprising apparatus or processes for manufacturing particular types of electrical conductors or cables, e.g.:
H01B13/004 (manufacturing rigid-tube cables)
H01B13/008 (manufacturing extensible conductors or cables)
H01B13/012 (manufacturing wire harnesses)
H01B13/016 (manufacturing coaxial cables)
Subgroups comprising apparatus or processes for a particular production step for manufacturing electrical conductors or cables, e.g.:
H01B13/0003 (for feeding conductors or cables)
H01B13/0006 (for reducing the size of conductors or cables)
H01B13/0009 (for forming corrugations on conductors or cables)
H01B13/0013 (for embedding wires in plastic layers)
H01B13/0016 (for heat treatment)
H01B13/0023 (for welding together plastic insulated wires side-by-side)
H01B13/0026 (for manufacturing conducting or semi-conducting layers)
H01B13/003 (using irradiation)
H01B13/0033 (electrostatic coating)
H01B13/0036 (details)
H01B13/02 (stranding-up)
H01B13/06 (insulating conductors or cables)
H01B13/22 (sheeting, armouring, screening or applying other protective layer)
H01B13/28 (applying continuous inductive loading)
H01B13/32 (filling or coating with impervious material)
H01B13/34 (for marking conductors or cables)

definition-item.definition-title: for manufacturing co-axial cables (applying discontinuous insulation H01B13/20)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Stranding-up

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {being rollers, pulleys, drums or belts (H01B13/0242 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: Insulating conductors or cables (H01B13/32 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Filling or coating with impervious material

definition-item.definition-title: {Insulating coaxial cables (H01B13/20 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Applying discontinuous insulation for concentric or coaxial cables

definition-item.definition-title: by extrusion {(extrusion in general B29C48/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Apparatus or processes specially adapted for manufacturing conductors or cables by extrusion
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Controlling the extrusion apparatus dependent on the capacitance or the thickness of the insulating material (measuring thickness G01B; testing during manufacturing G01R31/59)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Sheathing; Armouring; Screening; Applying other protective layers (H01B13/32 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Filling or coating with impervious material

definition-item.definition-title: by extrusion {(extrusion of cables with plastic material in general B29C48/15)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Apparatus or processes specially adapted for manufacturing conductors or cables by extrusion, wherein the protective layer is produced by extrusion.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus or processes specially adapted for manufacturing conductors or cables by extrusion, wherein the insulating layer is produced by extrusion

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: by winding, braiding or longitudinal lapping

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Drying; Impregnating (H01B13/32 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Apparatus or processes specially adapted for manufacturing conductors or cables by drying
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Drying and impregnating of wood or the like
Impregnation of stones, basic materials therefor
Fixed capacitors; Processes of their manufacture
Fixed capacitors; Processes of their manufacture; Solid dielectrics

definition-item.definition-title: Filling or coating with impervious material

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Apparatus or processes for salvaging material from cables (for removing insulation from conductors H02G1/12)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Dismantling of electric cables, e.g. for recycling.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus or processes for removing insulation from conductors

definition-item.definition-title: Insulators or insulating bodies characterised by their form

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Electrical insulators being separate basic electric elements; constructional details of electrical insulators.
Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus or processes specially adapted for manufacturing insulators or insulating bodies
Feed-throughs structurally associated with medical devices, e.g. for electrotherapy

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Leading of conductors through casings, structurally associated with transformers or inductances
Fixed capacitor being a feed-through capacitor
Arrangements leading cables or lines through walls

section-body.paragraph-text: This group is subdivided either into insulators or insulating bodies by their type, e.g.:
H01B17/02 (suspension insulators)
H01B17/14 (supporting insulators)
H01B17/20 (pin insulators)
H01B17/24 (apertured insulators)
H01B17/26 (lead-in insulators, lead-through insulators, bushings)
or by general constructional details of insulators or insulating bodies, e.g.:
H01B17/005 (with build-in electrical equipment)
H01B17/32 (single insulators consisting of two or more dissimilar insulating bodies)
H01B17/34 (insulators containing liquid, e.g. oil)
H01B17/36 (insulators having evacuated or gas-filled spaces)
H01B17/38 (fittings)
H01B17/42 (means for obtaining improved distribution of voltage)
H01B17/50 (with surfaces specially treated for preserving insulating properties)
H01B17/52 (having cleaning devices)
H01B17/54 (having heating or cooling devices)

definition-item.definition-title: Special features of strain insulators

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices for relieving mechanical tension of electric lines or cables

definition-item.definition-title: Supporting insulators (pin insulators H01B17/20; apertured insulators H01B17/24)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: {Fastening of insulators to support (H01B17/301 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Lead-in insulators; lead-through insulators; Sealing of insulators to support

definition-item.definition-title: Capacitor type

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Sealing

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Means for obtaining improved distribution of voltage (capacitor-type lead-through insulators H01B17/28); Protection against arc discharges

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Structural association of insulators with corona rings

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Means for providing an external arc-discharge path

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: having cleaning devices (H01B17/54 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Insulators or insulating bodies having heating or cooling devices

definition-item.definition-title: Insulating bodies

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Tubes, sleeves, beads, or bobbins through which the conductor passes

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Protective tubings for the installation of lines or cables in buildings

definition-item.definition-title: Composite insulating bodies

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Insulating-layers or insulating-films on metal bodies

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Conductive layers or films on insulating-bodies

definition-item.definition-title: with conductive admixtures, inserts or layers

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Conductive bodies comprising conductive material dispersed in insulating material

definition-item.definition-title: Apparatus or processes specially adapted for manufacturing insulators or insulating bodies {(manufacture of porcelain for electric insulation C04B33/26)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Apparatus or processes specially adapted for manufacturing insulators or insulating bodies
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Manufacture of porcelain for electric insulation

definition-item.definition-title: Drying; Impregnating

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
